vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apt` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. APT had several integer overflows and underflows while parsing .deb packages, aka GHSL-2020-168 GHSL-2020-169, in files apt-pkg/contrib/extracttar.cc, apt-pkg/deb/debfile.cc, and apt-pkg/contrib/arfile.cc. This issue affects: apt 1.2.32ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.2.32ubuntu0.2; 1.6.12ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.6.12ubuntu0.2; 2.0.2ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.0.2ubuntu0.2; 2.1.10ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.1.10ubuntu0.1; ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `apt` to version 1.4.11 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27350) - [CONFIRM](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1899193) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210108-0005/) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4808) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/usn/usn-4667-1)
vulnerabilities.name: apt/libapt-pkg5.0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apt` package. It was found that apt-key in apt, all versions, do not correctly validate gpg keys with the master keyring, leading to a potential man-in-the-middle attack. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `apt`. ## References - [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=642480) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-3374) - [MISC](https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2011/CVE-2011-3374.html) - [MISC](https://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/Sep/221) - [MISC](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-LINUX-APT-116518) - [MISC](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2011-3374) - [RedHat CVE Database](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2011-3374)
vulnerabilities.name: apt/libapt-pkg5.0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apt` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. Missing input validation in the ar/tar implementations of APT before version 2.1.2 could result in denial of service when processing specially crafted deb files. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `apt` to version 1.4.10 or higher. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-3810) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/U4PEH357MZM2SUGKETMEHMSGQS652QHH/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/Debian/apt/issues/111) - [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1878177) - [MISC](https://lists.debian.org/debian-security-announce/2020/msg00089.html) - [MISC](https://salsa.debian.org/apt-team/apt/-/commit/dceb1e49e4b8e4dadaf056be34088b415939cda6) - [MISC](https://tracker.debian.org/news/1144109/accepted-apt-212-source-into-unstable/) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4359-2/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-3810) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4359-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: apt/libapt-pkg5.0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Check for Dropped Privileges
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `bash` package. An issue was discovered in disable_priv_mode in shell.c in GNU Bash through 5.0 patch 11. By default, if Bash is run with its effective UID not equal to its real UID, it will drop privileges by setting its effective UID to its real UID. However, it does so incorrectly. On Linux and other systems that support "saved UID" functionality, the saved UID is not dropped. An attacker with command execution in the shell can use "enable -f" for runtime loading of a new builtin, which can be a shared object that calls setuid() and therefore regains privileges. However, binaries running with an effective UID of 0 are unaffected. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `bash`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0003/) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-18276) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202105-34) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/bminor/bash/commit/951bdaad7a18cc0dc1036bba86b18b90874d39ff) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/155498/Bash-5.0-Patch-11-Privilege-Escalation.html) - [MISC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-wGtxJ8opa8) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-18276)
vulnerabilities.name: bash

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `coreutils` package. chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `coreutils`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2781) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/2) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/3) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-2781)
vulnerabilities.name: coreutils

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `coreutils` package. In GNU Coreutils through 8.29, chown-core.c in chown and chgrp does not prevent replacement of a plain file with a symlink during use of the POSIX "-R -L" options, which allows local users to modify the ownership of arbitrary files by leveraging a race condition. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `coreutils`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-18018) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18018) - [http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/coreutils/2017-12/msg00045.html](http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/coreutils/2017-12/msg00045.html)
vulnerabilities.name: coreutils

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `e2fsprogs` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the quota file functionality of E2fsprogs 1.45.3. A specially crafted ext4 partition can cause an out-of-bounds write on the heap, resulting in code execution. An attacker can corrupt a partition to trigger this vulnerability. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `e2fsprogs` to version 1.43.4-2+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5094) - [Bugtraq Mailing List](https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Sep/58) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200115-0002/) - [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2019/dsa-4535) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/09/msg00029.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-5094) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2AKETJ6BREDUHRWQTV35SPGG5C6H7KSI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6DOBCYQKCTTWXBLMUPJ5TX3FY7JNCOKY/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-05) - [Talos Vulnerability Report](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2019-0887) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4142-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-5094) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4142-2/)
vulnerabilities.name: e2fsprogs/e2fslibs

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `e2fsprogs` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. A code execution vulnerability exists in the directory rehashing functionality of E2fsprogs e2fsck 1.45.4. A specially crafted ext4 directory can cause an out-of-bounds write on the stack, resulting in code execution. An attacker can corrupt a partition to trigger this vulnerability. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `e2fsprogs` to version 1.43.4-2+deb9u2 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5188) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-5188) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2AKETJ6BREDUHRWQTV35SPGG5C6H7KSI/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6DOBCYQKCTTWXBLMUPJ5TX3FY7JNCOKY/) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/03/msg00030.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/07/msg00021.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-02/msg00004.html) - [Talos Vulnerability Report](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2019-0973) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-5188) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4249-1/)

An attacker can corrupt a partition to trigger this vulnerability. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `e2fsprogs` to version 1.43.4-2+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5094) - [Bugtraq Mailing List](https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Sep/58) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200115-0002/) - [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2019/dsa-4535) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/09/msg00029.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-5094) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2AKETJ6BREDUHRWQTV35SPGG5C6H7KSI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6DOBCYQKCTTWXBLMUPJ5TX3FY7JNCOKY/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-05) - [Talos Vulnerability Report](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2019-0887) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4142-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-5094) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4142-2/)

vulnerabilities.title: XML External Entity (XXE) Injection
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `expat` package. expat 2.1.0 and earlier does not properly handle entities expansion unless an application developer uses the XML_SetEntityDeclHandler function, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption), send HTTP requests to intranet servers, or read arbitrary files via a crafted XML document, aka an XML External Entity (XXE) issue. NOTE: it could be argued that because expat already provides the ability to disable external entity expansion, the responsibility for resolving this issue lies with application developers; according to this argument, this entry should be REJECTed, and each affected application would need its own CVE. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `expat`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212804) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212805) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212807) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212814) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212815) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212819) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-0340) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/33) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/34) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/35) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/38) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/39) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/40) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201701-21) - [http://securitytracker.com/id?1028213](http://securitytracker.com/id?1028213) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r41eca5f4f09e74436cbb05dec450fc2bef37b5d3e966aa7cc5fada6d@%3Cannounce.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rfb2c193360436e230b85547e85a41bea0916916f96c501f5b6fc4702@%3Cusers.openoffice.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/10/07/4) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/02/22/3) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/04/12/6) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/58233)
vulnerabilities.name: expat/libexpat1

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `expat` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. In libexpat before 2.2.8, crafted XML input could fool the parser into changing from DTD parsing to document parsing too early; a consecutive call to XML_GetCurrentLineNumber (or XML_GetCurrentColumnNumber) then resulted in a heap-based buffer over-read. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `expat` to version 2.2.0-2+deb9u3 or higher. ## References - vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `freetype` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. Heap buffer overflow in Freetype in Google Chrome prior to 86.0.4240.111 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `freetype` to version 2.6.3-3.2+deb9u2 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-15999) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4824) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/J3QVIGAAJ4D62YEJAJJWMCCBCOQ6TVL7/) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Nov/33) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202011-12) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202012-04) - [MISC](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2020/10/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_20.html) - [MISC](https://crbug.com/1139963) - [MISC](https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/p/rca-cve-2020-15999.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-11/msg00016.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gcc-6` package. stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `gcc-6`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gcc.gnu.org/viewcvs/gcc/trunk/gcc/config/arm/arm-protos.h?revision=266379&view=markup) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-12886) - [MISC](https://www.gnu.org/software/gcc/gcc-8/changes.html)
vulnerabilities.name: gcc-6/libstdc++6

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gettext` package. An issue was discovered in GNU gettext 0.19.8. There is a double free in default_add_message in read-catalog.c, related to an invalid free in po_gram_parse in po-gram-gen.y, as demonstrated by lt-msgfmt. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `gettext`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-18751) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18751) - [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/CCCCCrash/POCs/tree/master/Bin/Tools-gettext-0.19.8.1/doublefree) - [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/CCCCCrash/POCs/tree/master/Bin/Tools-gettext-0.19.8.1/heapcorruption) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3643) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00061.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00065.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00025.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-18751) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3815-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3815-2/)
vulnerabilities.name: gettext/gettext-base

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3 encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3326) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210304-0007/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27256) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=7d88c6142c6efc160c0ee5e4f85cde382c072888) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/28/2)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-27645) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7LZNT6KTMCCWPWXEOGSHD3YLYZKUGMH5/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7TS26LIZSOBLGJEZMJX4PXT5BQDE2WS/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27462)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33574) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-07) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The wordexp function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.33 may crash or read arbitrary memory in parse_param (in posix/wordexp.c) when called with an untrusted, crafted pattern, potentially resulting in a denial of service or disclosure of information. This occurs because atoi was used but strtoul should have been used to ensure correct calculations. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-35942) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210827-0005/) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=28011) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=5adda61f62b77384718b4c0d8336ade8f2b4b35c) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/glibc/wiki/Security%20Exceptions)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(|)(\\1\\1)*' in grep, a different issue than CVE-2018-20796. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because the behavior occurs only with a crafted pattern. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9192) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24269) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9192)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Data Handling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K64119434) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K64119434?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2009-5155) - [MISC](http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/gnulib.git/commit/?id=5513b40999149090987a0341c018d05d3eea1272) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=22793) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=32806) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=34238) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=11053) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=18986) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=eb04c21373e2a2885f3d52ff192b0499afe3c672) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190315-0002/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2009-5155)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, proceed_next_node in posix/regexec.c has a heap-based buffer over-read via an attempted case-insensitive regular-expression match. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10278) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K54823184) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9169) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=34140) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=34142) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24114) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=583dd860d5b833037175247230a328f0050dbfe9) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190315-0002/) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/107160) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9169)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20796) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=34141) - [MISC](https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-gnulib/2019-01/msg00108.html) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190315-0002/) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/107160) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20796)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, the memcmp function for the x32 architecture can incorrectly return zero (indicating that the inputs are equal) because the RDX most significant bit is mishandled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7309) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24155) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/ml/libc-alpha/2019-02/msg00041.html) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106835) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-7309)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/03/01/10) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96525) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10228)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Data Handling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The pop_fail_stack function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via vectors related to extended regular expression processing. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=779392) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-8985) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201908-06) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/02/14/9) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/76916) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2015-8985)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The DNS stub resolver in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before version 2.26, when EDNS support is enabled, will solicit large UDP responses from name servers, potentially simplifying off-path DNS spoofing attacks due to IP fragmentation. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-12132) - [MISC](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1205.4011.pdf) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=21361) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0805) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100598) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-12132)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An integer overflow in the implementation of the posix_memalign in memalign functions in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.26 and earlier could cause these functions to return a pointer to a heap area that is too small, potentially leading to heap corruption. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22343) - [Debian Bug Report](http://bugs.debian.org/878159) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6485) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/) - [Oracle Security Advisory](https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpuapr2019-5072813.html) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3092) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102912) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-6485) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4218-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Resource Shutdown or Release
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The string component in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, when running on the x32 architecture, incorrectly attempts to use a 64-bit register for size_t in assembly codes, which can lead to a segmentation fault or possibly unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by a crash in __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms in sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S during a memcpy. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-6488) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24097) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106671)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10739) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=20018) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00082.html) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3513) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1347549) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2118) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106672) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10739)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The glob implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in STAT commands to an FTP daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4756) - [http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c](http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c) - [http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89) - [http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223](http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=681681) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2010-4756)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In glibc 2.26 and earlier there is confusion in the usage of getcwd() by realpath() which can be used to write before the destination buffer leading to a buffer underflow and potential code execution. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000001) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43775/) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/44889/) - [MISC](https://www.halfdog.net/Security/2017/LibcRealpathBufferUnderflow/) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/) - [Oss-Sec Mailing List](http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2018/q1/38) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0805) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102525) - [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1040162) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000001) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3534-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3536-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The malloc implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6), from version 2.24 to 2.26 on powerpc, and only in version 2.26 on i386, did not properly handle malloc calls with arguments close to SIZE_MAX and could return a pointer to a heap region that is smaller than requested, eventually leading to heap corruption. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22774) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=8e448310d74b283c5cd02b9ed7fb997b47bf9b22) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6551) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K11932200?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010023) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22851) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/109167) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010023)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010022) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850#c3) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010022)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may guess the heap addresses of pthread_created thread. The component is: glibc. NOTE: the vendor's position is "ASLR bypass itself is not a vulnerability." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010025) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22853) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010025)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass ASLR using cache of thread stack and heap. The component is: glibc. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010024) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22852) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/109162) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010024)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. On the x86-64 architecture, the GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.31 fails to ignore the LD_PREFER_MAP_32BIT_EXEC environment variable during program execution after a security transition, allowing local attackers to restrict the possible mapping addresses for loaded libraries and thus bypass ASLR for a setuid program. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19126) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4FQ5LC6JOYSOYFPRUZ4S45KL6IP3RPPZ/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZFJ5E7NWOL6ROE5QVICHKIOUGCPFJVUH/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25204) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19126)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10029) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10029) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/JZTFUD5VH2GU3YOXA2KBQSBIDZRDWNZ3/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VU5JJGENOK7K4X5RYAA5PL647C6HD22E/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/23N76M3EDP2GIW4GOIQRYTKRE7PPBRB2/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25487) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=9333498794cde1d5cca518badf79533a24114b6f) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200327-0003/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00033.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1751) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1751) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25423) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1751) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25414) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=ddc650e9b3dc916eab417ce9f79e67337b05035c) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1752) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200511-0005/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1752) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1752)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620) - [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)

The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3 encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3326) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210304-0007/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27256) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=7d88c6142c6efc160c0ee5e4f85cde382c072888) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/28/2)

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-27645) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7LZNT6KTMCCWPWXEOGSHD3YLYZKUGMH5/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7TS26LIZSOBLGJEZMJX4PXT5BQDE2WS/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27462)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33574) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-07) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The wordexp function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.33 may crash or read arbitrary memory in parse_param (in posix/wordexp.c) when called with an untrusted, crafted pattern, potentially resulting in a denial of service or disclosure of information. This occurs because atoi was used but strtoul should have been used to ensure correct calculations. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-35942) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210827-0005/) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=28011) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=5adda61f62b77384718b4c0d8336ade8f2b4b35c) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/glibc/wiki/Security%20Exceptions)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(|)(\\1\\1)*' in grep, a different issue than CVE-2018-20796. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because the behavior occurs only with a crafted pattern. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9192) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24269) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9192)

An integer overflow in the implementation of the posix_memalign in memalign functions in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.26 and earlier could cause these functions to return a pointer to a heap area that is too small, potentially leading to heap corruption. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22343) - [Debian Bug Report](http://bugs.debian.org/878159) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6485) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/) - [Oracle Security Advisory](https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpuapr2019-5072813.html) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3092) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102912) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-6485) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4218-1/)

The string component in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, when running on the x32 architecture, incorrectly attempts to use a 64-bit register for size_t in assembly codes, which can lead to a segmentation fault or possibly unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by a crash in __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms in sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S during a memcpy. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-6488) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24097) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106671)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10739) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=20018) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00082.html) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3513) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1347549) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2118) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106672) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10739)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The glob implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in STAT commands to an FTP daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4756) - [http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c](http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c) - [http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89) - [http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223](http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=681681) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2010-4756)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In glibc 2.26 and earlier there is confusion in the usage of getcwd() by realpath() which can be used to write before the destination buffer leading to a buffer underflow and potential code execution. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000001) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43775/) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/44889/) - [MISC](https://www.halfdog.net/Security/2017/LibcRealpathBufferUnderflow/) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/) - [Oss-Sec Mailing List](http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2018/q1/38) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0805) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102525) - [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1040162) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000001) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3534-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3536-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The malloc implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6), from version 2.24 to 2.26 on powerpc, and only in version 2.26 on i386, did not properly handle malloc calls with arguments close to SIZE_MAX and could return a pointer to a heap region that is smaller than requested, eventually leading to heap corruption. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22774) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=8e448310d74b283c5cd02b9ed7fb997b47bf9b22) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6551) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K11932200?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010023) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22851) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/109167) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010023)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010022) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850#c3) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010022)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may guess the heap addresses of pthread_created thread. The component is: glibc. NOTE: the vendor's position is "ASLR bypass itself is not a vulnerability." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010025) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22853) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010025)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass ASLR using cache of thread stack and heap. The component is: glibc. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010024) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22852) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/109162) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010024)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. On the x86-64 architecture, the GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.31 fails to ignore the LD_PREFER_MAP_32BIT_EXEC environment variable during program execution after a security transition, allowing local attackers to restrict the possible mapping addresses for loaded libraries and thus bypass ASLR for a setuid program. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19126) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4FQ5LC6JOYSOYFPRUZ4S45KL6IP3RPPZ/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZFJ5E7NWOL6ROE5QVICHKIOUGCPFJVUH/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25204) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19126)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10029) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10029) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/JZTFUD5VH2GU3YOXA2KBQSBIDZRDWNZ3/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VU5JJGENOK7K4X5RYAA5PL647C6HD22E/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/23N76M3EDP2GIW4GOIQRYTKRE7PPBRB2/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25487) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=9333498794cde1d5cca518badf79533a24114b6f) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200327-0003/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00033.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1751) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1751) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25423) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1751) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25414) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=ddc650e9b3dc916eab417ce9f79e67337b05035c) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1752) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200511-0005/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1752) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1752)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620) - [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)

The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References -
