vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3 encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3326) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210304-0007/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27256) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=7d88c6142c6efc160c0ee5e4f85cde382c072888) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/28/2)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-27645) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7LZNT6KTMCCWPWXEOGSHD3YLYZKUGMH5/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7TS26LIZSOBLGJEZMJX4PXT5BQDE2WS/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27462)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33574) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-07) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The wordexp function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.33 may crash or read arbitrary memory in parse_param (in posix/wordexp.c) when called with an untrusted, crafted pattern, potentially resulting in a denial of service or disclosure of information. This occurs because atoi was used but strtoul should have been used to ensure correct calculations. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-35942) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210827-0005/) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=28011) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=5adda61f62b77384718b4c0d8336ade8f2b4b35c) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/glibc/wiki/Security%20Exceptions)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(|)(\\1\\1)*' in grep, a different issue than CVE-2018-20796. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because the behavior occurs only with a crafted pattern. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9192) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24269) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9192)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Data Handling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K64119434) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K64119434?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2009-5155) - [MISC](http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/gnulib.git/commit/?id=5513b40999149090987a0341c018d05d3eea1272) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=22793) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=32806) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=34238) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=11053) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=18986) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=eb04c21373e2a2885f3d52ff192b0499afe3c672) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190315-0002/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2009-5155)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, proceed_next_node in posix/regexec.c has a heap-based buffer over-read via an attempted case-insensitive regular-expression match. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10278) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K54823184) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9169) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=34140) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=34142) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24114) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=583dd860d5b833037175247230a328f0050dbfe9) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190315-0002/) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/107160) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9169)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20796) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=34141) - [MISC](https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-gnulib/2019-01/msg00108.html) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190315-0002/) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/107160) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20796)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, the memcmp function for the x32 architecture can incorrectly return zero (indicating that the inputs are equal) because the RDX most significant bit is mishandled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7309) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24155) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/ml/libc-alpha/2019-02/msg00041.html) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106835) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-7309)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/03/01/10) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96525) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10228)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Data Handling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The pop_fail_stack function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via vectors related to extended regular expression processing. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=779392) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-8985) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201908-06) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/02/14/9) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/76916) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2015-8985)

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The DNS stub resolver in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before version 2.26, when EDNS support is enabled, will solicit large UDP responses from name servers, potentially simplifying off-path DNS spoofing attacks due to IP fragmentation. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-12132) - [MISC](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1205.4011.pdf) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=21361) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0805) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100598) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-12132)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An integer overflow in the implementation of the posix_memalign in memalign functions in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.26 and earlier could cause these functions to return a pointer to a heap area that is too small, potentially leading to heap corruption. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22343) - [Debian Bug Report](http://bugs.debian.org/878159) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6485) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/) - [Oracle Security Advisory](https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpuapr2019-5072813.html) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3092) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102912) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-6485) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4218-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Resource Shutdown or Release
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The string component in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, when running on the x32 architecture, incorrectly attempts to use a 64-bit register for size_t in assembly codes, which can lead to a segmentation fault or possibly unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by a crash in __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms in sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S during a memcpy. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-6488) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24097) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106671)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10739) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=20018) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00082.html) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3513) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1347549) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2118) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106672) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10739)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The glob implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in STAT commands to an FTP daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4756) - [http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c](http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c) - [http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89) - [http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223](http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=681681) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2010-4756)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In glibc 2.26 and earlier there is confusion in the usage of getcwd() by realpath() which can be used to write before the destination buffer leading to a buffer underflow and potential code execution. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000001) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43775/) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/44889/) - [MISC](https://www.halfdog.net/Security/2017/LibcRealpathBufferUnderflow/) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/) - [Oss-Sec Mailing List](http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2018/q1/38) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0805) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102525) - [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1040162) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000001) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3534-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3536-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The malloc implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6), from version 2.24 to 2.26 on powerpc, and only in version 2.26 on i386, did not properly handle malloc calls with arguments close to SIZE_MAX and could return a pointer to a heap region that is smaller than requested, eventually leading to heap corruption. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22774) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=8e448310d74b283c5cd02b9ed7fb997b47bf9b22) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6551) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K11932200?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010023) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22851) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/109167) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010023)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010022) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850#c3) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010022)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may guess the heap addresses of pthread_created thread. The component is: glibc. NOTE: the vendor's position is "ASLR bypass itself is not a vulnerability." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010025) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22853) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010025)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass ASLR using cache of thread stack and heap. The component is: glibc. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010024) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22852) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/109162) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010024)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. On the x86-64 architecture, the GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.31 fails to ignore the LD_PREFER_MAP_32BIT_EXEC environment variable during program execution after a security transition, allowing local attackers to restrict the possible mapping addresses for loaded libraries and thus bypass ASLR for a setuid program. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19126) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4FQ5LC6JOYSOYFPRUZ4S45KL6IP3RPPZ/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZFJ5E7NWOL6ROE5QVICHKIOUGCPFJVUH/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25204) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19126)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10029) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10029) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/JZTFUD5VH2GU3YOXA2KBQSBIDZRDWNZ3/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VU5JJGENOK7K4X5RYAA5PL647C6HD22E/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/23N76M3EDP2GIW4GOIQRYTKRE7PPBRB2/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25487) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=9333498794cde1d5cca518badf79533a24114b6f) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200327-0003/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00033.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1751) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1751) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25423) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1751) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25414) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=ddc650e9b3dc916eab417ce9f79e67337b05035c) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1752) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200511-0005/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1752) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1752)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620) - [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/multiarch-support

vulnerabilities.title: Key Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gnupg2` package. GnuPG 2.2.4 and 2.2.5 does not enforce a configuration in which key certification requires an offline master Certify key, which results in apparently valid certifications that occurred only with access to a signing subkey. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `gnupg2`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-9234) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T3844) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-9234) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3675-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: gnupg2/gpgv

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF)
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gnupg2` package. GnuPG version 2.1.12 - 2.2.11 contains a Cross ite Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in dirmngr that can result in Attacker controlled CSRF, Information Disclosure, DoS. This attack appear to be exploitable via Victim must perform a WKD request, e.g. enter an email address in the composer window of Thunderbird/Enigmail. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in after commit 4a4bb874f63741026bd26264c43bb32b1099f060. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `gnupg2`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000858) - [MISC](https://sektioneins.de/en/advisories/advisory-012018-gnupg-wkd.html) - [MISC](https://sektioneins.de/en/blog/18-11-23-gnupg-wkd.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000858) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3853-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: gnupg2/gpgv

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `icu` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. International Components for Unicode (ICU-20850) v66.1 was discovered to contain a use after free bug in the pkg_createWithAssemblyCode function in the file tools/pkgdata/pkgdata.cpp. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `icu` to version 57.1-6+deb9u5 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-21913) - [MISC](https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/pull/886) - [MISC](https://unicode-org.atlassian.net/browse/ICU-20850) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/10/msg00008.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `icu` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. An issue was discovered in International Components for Unicode (ICU) for C/C++ through 66.1. An integer overflow, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow, exists in the UnicodeString::doAppend() function in common/unistr.cpp. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `icu` to version 57.1-6+deb9u4 or higher. ## References - [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4646) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/03/msg00024.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10531) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4OOYAMJVLLCLXDTHW3V5UXNULZBBK4O6/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6IOHSO6BUKC6I66J5PZOMAGFVJ66ZS57/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/X3B5RWJQD5LA45MYLLR55KZJOJ5NVZGP/) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-15) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/commit/b7d08bc04a4296982fcef8b6b8a354a9e4e7afca) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/pull/971) - [MISC](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1044570) - [MISC](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2020/02/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html) - [MISC](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/deps/icu/+/9f4020916eb1f28f3666f018fdcbe6c9a37f0e08) - [MISC](https://unicode-org.atlassian.net/browse/ICU-20958) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2021.html) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2020:0738) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-04/msg00004.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4305-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10531)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `jbigkit` package. In LibTIFF 4.0.8, there is a memory malloc failure in tif_jbig.c. A crafted TIFF document can lead to an abort resulting in a remote denial of service attack. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `jbigkit`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9937) - [MISC](http://bugzilla.maptools.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2707) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99304) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-9937)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libbsd` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. nlist.c in libbsd before 0.10.0 has an out-of-bounds read during a comparison for a symbol name from the string table (strtab). ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libbsd` to version 0.8.3-1+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20367) - [MISC](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/libbsd/libbsd/commit/9d917aad37778a9f4a96ba358415f077f3f36f3b) - [MISC](https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/libbsd/2019-August/000229.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r0e913668380f59bcbd14fdd8ae8d24f95f99995e290cd18a7822c6e5@%3Cdev.tomee.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/ra781e51cf1ec40381c98cddc073b3576fb56c3978f4564d2fa431550@%3Cdev.tomee.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/02/msg00027.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-05/msg00043.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20367) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4243-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. Libgcrypt before 1.8.8 and 1.9.x before 1.9.3 mishandles ElGamal encryption because it lacks exponent blinding to address a side-channel attack against mpi_powm, and the window size is not chosen appropriately. This, for example, affects use of ElGamal in OpenPGP. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33560) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BKKTOIGFW2SGN3DO2UHHVZ7MJSYN4AAB/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/R7OAPCUGPF3VLA7QAJUQSL255D4ITVTL/) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/rCe8b7f10be275bcedb5fc05ed4837a89bfd605c61) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5305) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5328) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5466) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00021.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. The ElGamal implementation in Libgcrypt before 1.9.4 allows plaintext recovery because, during interaction between two cryptographic libraries, a certain dangerous combination of the prime defined by the receiver's public key, the generator defined by the receiver's public key, and the sender's ephemeral exponents can lead to a cross-configuration attack against OpenPGP. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libgcrypt20` to version 1.7.6-2+deb9u4 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-40528) - [MISC](https://eprint.iacr.org/2021/923) - [MISC](https://ibm.github.io/system-security-research-updates/2021/07/20/insecurity-elgamal-pt1) - [MISC](https://ibm.github.io/system-security-research-updates/2021/09/06/insecurity-elgamal-pt2)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. cipher/elgamal.c in Libgcrypt through 1.8.2, when used to encrypt messages directly, improperly encodes plaintexts, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading ciphertext data (i.e., it does not have semantic security in face of a ciphertext-only attack). The Decisional Diffie-Hellman (DDH) assumption does not hold for Libgcrypt's ElGamal implementation. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6829) - [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal) - [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal/wiki) - [MISC](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gcrypt-devel/2018-February/004394.html) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2020.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. It was discovered that there was a ECDSA timing attack in the libgcrypt20 cryptographic library. Version affected: 1.8.4-5, 1.7.6-2+deb9u3, and 1.6.3-2+deb8u4. Versions fixed: 1.8.5-2 and 1.6.3-2+deb8u7. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13627) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/09/msg00024.html) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/01/msg00001.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13627) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-32) - [GitHub Release](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/releases/tag/libgcrypt-1.8.5) - [MISC](https://minerva.crocs.fi.muni.cz/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00060.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-01/msg00018.html) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/10/02/2) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13627) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-2/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-3/)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. Libgcrypt before 1.8.8 and 1.9.x before 1.9.3 mishandles ElGamal encryption because it lacks exponent blinding to address a side-channel attack against mpi_powm, and the window size is not chosen appropriately. This, for example, affects use of ElGamal in OpenPGP. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33560) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BKKTOIGFW2SGN3DO2UHHVZ7MJSYN4AAB/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/R7OAPCUGPF3VLA7QAJUQSL255D4ITVTL/) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/rCe8b7f10be275bcedb5fc05ed4837a89bfd605c61) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5305) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5328) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5466) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00021.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. The ElGamal implementation in Libgcrypt before 1.9.4 allows plaintext recovery because, during interaction between two cryptographic libraries, a certain dangerous combination of the prime defined by the receiver's public key, the generator defined by the receiver's public key, and the sender's ephemeral exponents can lead to a cross-configuration attack against OpenPGP. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libgcrypt20` to version 1.7.6-2+deb9u4 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-40528) - [MISC](https://eprint.iacr.org/2021/923) - [MISC](https://ibm.github.io/system-security-research-updates/2021/07/20/insecurity-elgamal-pt1) - [MISC](https://ibm.github.io/system-security-research-updates/2021/09/06/insecurity-elgamal-pt2)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. cipher/elgamal.c in Libgcrypt through 1.8.2, when used to encrypt messages directly, improperly encodes plaintexts, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading ciphertext data (i.e., it does not have semantic security in face of a ciphertext-only attack). The Decisional Diffie-Hellman (DDH) assumption does not hold for Libgcrypt's ElGamal implementation. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6829) - [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal) - [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal/wiki) - [MISC](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gcrypt-devel/2018-February/004394.html) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2020.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. It was discovered that there was a ECDSA timing attack in the libgcrypt20 cryptographic library. Version affected: 1.8.4-5, 1.7.6-2+deb9u3, and 1.6.3-2+deb8u4. Versions fixed: 1.8.5-2 and 1.6.3-2+deb8u7. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13627) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/09/msg00024.html) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/01/msg00001.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13627) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-32) - [GitHub Release](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/releases/tag/libgcrypt-1.8.5) - [MISC](https://minerva.crocs.fi.muni.cz/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00060.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-01/msg00018.html) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/10/02/2) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13627) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-2/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-3/)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgd2` package. read_header_tga in gd_tga.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka LibGD) through 2.3.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted TGA file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgd2`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-38115) - [MISC](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/issues/697) - [MISC](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/pull/711/commits/8b111b2b4a4842179be66db68d84dda91a246032)
vulnerabilities.name: libgd2/libgd3

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgd2` package. ** DISPUTED ** gdImageGd2Ptr in gd_gd2.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka LibGD) through 2.3.2 has a double free. NOTE: the vendor's position is "The GD2 image format is a proprietary image format of libgd. It has to be regarded as being obsolete, and should only be used for development and testing purposes." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgd2`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-40145) - [MISC](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/commit/c5fd25ce0e48fd5618a972ca9f5e28d6d62006af) - [MISC](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/issues/700) - [MISC](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/pull/713)
vulnerabilities.name: libgd2/libgd3

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgd2` package. The GD Graphics Library (aka LibGD) through 2.3.2 has an out-of-bounds read because of the lack of certain gdGetBuf and gdPutBuf return value checks. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgd2`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-40812) - [MISC](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/commit/6f5136821be86e7068fcdf651ae9420b5d42e9a9) - [MISC](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/issues/750#issuecomment-914872385)
vulnerabilities.name: libgd2/libgd3

vulnerabilities.title: Use of Uninitialized Resource
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgd2` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. When using the gdImageCreateFromXbm() function in the GD Graphics Library (aka LibGD) 2.2.5, as used in the PHP GD extension in PHP versions 7.1.x below 7.1.30, 7.2.x below 7.2.19 and 7.3.x below 7.3.6, it is possible to supply data that will cause the function to use the value of uninitialized variable. This may lead to disclosing contents of the stack that has been left there by previous code. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libgd2` to version 2.2.4-2+deb9u5 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-11038) - [Bugtraq Mailing List](https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Sep/38) - [CONFIRM](https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=77973) - [CONFIRM](https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1140118) - [CONFIRM](https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1140120) - [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=929821) - [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2019/dsa-4529) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/06/msg00003.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-11038) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3CZ2QADQTKRHTGB2AHD7J4QQNDLBEMM6/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/PKSSWFR2WPMUOIB5EN5ZM252NNEPYUTG/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/WAZBVK6XNYEIN7RDQXESSD63QHXPLKWL/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/issues/501) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00020.html) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1724149) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1724432) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2519) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3299) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4316-1/) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4316-2/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-11038)
vulnerabilities.name: libgd2/libgd3

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgd2` package. gdImageClone in gd.c in libgd 2.1.0-rc2 through 2.2.5 has a NULL pointer dereference allowing attackers to crash an application via a specific function call sequence. Only affects PHP when linked with an external libgd (not bundled). ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgd2`. ## References - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/02/msg00014.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-14553) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3CZ2QADQTKRHTGB2AHD7J4QQNDLBEMM6/) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/commit/a93eac0e843148dc2d631c3ba80af17e9c8c860f) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/pull/580) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1599032) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00020.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4316-1/) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4316-2/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-14553)
vulnerabilities.name: libgd2/libgd3

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgd2` package. ** DISPUTED ** In the GD Graphics Library (aka LibGD) through 2.2.5, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in tiffWriter in gd_tiff.c. NOTE: the vendor says "In my opinion this issue should not have a CVE, since the GD and GD2 formats are documented to be 'obsolete, and should only be used for development and testing purposes.'" ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libgd2`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6363) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/libgd/libgd/issues/383)
vulnerabilities.name: libgd2/libgd3

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. Libjpeg-turbo all version have a stack-based buffer overflow in the "transform" component. A remote attacker can send a malformed jpeg file to the service and cause arbitrary code execution or denial of service of the target service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-17541) - [MISC](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/issues/392)
vulnerabilities.name: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo

vulnerabilities.title: Divide By Zero
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. libjpeg-turbo 1.5.90 is vulnerable to a denial of service vulnerability caused by a divide by zero when processing a crafted BMP image. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo` to version 1:1.5.1-2+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1152) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00015.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1152) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/commit/43e84cff1bb2bd8293066f6ac4eb0df61ddddbc6) - [MISC](https://www.tenable.com/security/research/tra-2018-17) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/07/msg00033.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00015.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00015.html) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/104543) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1152) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3706-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3706-2/)
vulnerabilities.name: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. libjpeg-turbo 1.5.2 has a NULL Pointer Dereference in jdpostct.c and jquant1.c via a crafted JPEG file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15232) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15232) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/mozilla/mozjpeg/issues/268) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/pull/182) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15232) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3706-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. get_8bit_row in rdbmp.c in libjpeg-turbo through 1.5.90 and MozJPEG through 3.3.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted 8-bit BMP in which one or more of the color indices is out of range for the number of palette entries. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo` to version 1:1.5.1-2+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-14498) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/03/msg00021.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-14498) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/F7YP4QUEYGHI4Q7GIAVFVKWQ7DJMBYLU/) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/commit/9c78a04df4e44ef6487eee99c4258397f4fdca55) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/issues/258) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/mozilla/mozjpeg/issues/299) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/07/msg00033.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00015.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00015.html) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2052) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3705) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4190-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-14498)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. In generate_jsimd_ycc_rgb_convert_neon of jsimd_arm64_neon.S, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. libjpeg-turbo 2.0.4, and mozjpeg 4.0.0, has a heap-based buffer over-read in get_rgb_row() in rdppm.c via a malformed PPM input file. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo` to version 1:1.5.1-2+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13790) - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13790) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/P4D6KNUY7YANSPH7SVQ44PJKSABFKAUB/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/U6563YHSVZK24MPJXGJVK3CQG7JVWZGK/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202010-03) - [MISC](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/commit/3de15e0c344d11d4b90f4a47136467053eb2d09a) - [MISC](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/issues/433) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/07/msg00033.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00031.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00062.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4386-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo

vulnerabilities.title: Excessive Iteration
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. libjpeg 9c has a large loop because read_pixel in rdtarga.c mishandles EOF. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-11813) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-11813) - [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/ChijinZ/security_advisories/tree/master/libjpeg-v9c) - [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/727908) - [MISC](https://github.com/ChijinZ/security_advisories/blob/master/libjpeg-v9c/mail.pdf) - [MISC](http://www.ijg.org/files/jpegsrc.v9d.tar.gz) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00015.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00015.html) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2052)
vulnerabilities.name: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Exhaustion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. In IJG JPEG (aka libjpeg) before 9d, jpeg_mem_available() in jmemnobs.c in djpeg does not honor the max_memory_to_use setting, possibly causing excessive memory consumption. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo` to version 1:1.5.1-2+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-14152) - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-14152) - [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/727908) - [MISC](http://www.ijg.org/files/jpegsrc.v9d.tar.gz) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/07/msg00033.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. Libjpeg-turbo all version have a stack-based buffer overflow in the "transform" component. A remote attacker can send a malformed jpeg file to the service and cause arbitrary code execution or denial of service of the target service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-17541) - [MISC](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/issues/392)
vulnerabilities.name: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo

vulnerabilities.title: Divide By Zero
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. libjpeg-turbo 1.5.90 is vulnerable to a denial of service vulnerability caused by a divide by zero when processing a crafted BMP image. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo` to version 1:1.5.1-2+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1152) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00015.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1152) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/commit/43e84cff1bb2bd8293066f6ac4eb0df61ddddbc6) - [MISC](https://www.tenable.com/security/research/tra-2018-17) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/07/msg00033.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00015.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00015.html) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/104543) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1152) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3706-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3706-2/)
vulnerabilities.name: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. libjpeg-turbo 1.5.2 has a NULL Pointer Dereference in jdpostct.c and jquant1.c via a crafted JPEG file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15232) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15232) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/mozilla/mozjpeg/issues/268) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/pull/182) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15232) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3706-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. get_8bit_row in rdbmp.c in libjpeg-turbo through 1.5.90 and MozJPEG through 3.3.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted 8-bit BMP in which one or more of the color indices is out of range for the number of palette entries. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo` to version 1:1.5.1-2+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-14498) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/03/msg00021.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-14498) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/F7YP4QUEYGHI4Q7GIAVFVKWQ7DJMBYLU/) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/commit/9c78a04df4e44ef6487eee99c4258397f4fdca55) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/issues/258) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/mozilla/mozjpeg/issues/299) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/07/msg00033.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00015.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00015.html) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2052) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3705) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4190-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-14498)
vulnerabilities.name: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libjpeg-turbo` package. In generate_jsimd_ycc_rgb_convert_neon of jsimd_arm64_neon.S, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote code execution in an unprivileged process with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.0 Android-8.1 Android-9 Android-10Android ID: A-120551338 ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libjpeg-turbo`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-2201) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-2201) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/Y4QPASQPZO644STRFTLOD35RIRGWWRNI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-23) - [MISC](https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/2019-11-01) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rc800763a88775ac9abb83b3402bcd0913d41ac65fdfc759af38f2280@%3Ccommits.mxnet.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-11/msg00047.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-11/msg00048.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-2201) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4190-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libpng1.6` package. An issue has been found in libpng 1.6.34. It is a SEGV in the function png_free_data in png.c, related to the recommended error handling for png_read_image. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libpng1.6`. ## References - [Bugtraq Mailing List](https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Apr/30) - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-14048) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-14048) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201908-02) - [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/fouzhe/security/tree/master/libpng) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/glennrp/libpng/issues/238) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/152561/Slackware-Security-Advisory-libpng-Updates.html) - [Oracle Security Advisory](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpuoct2018-4428296.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-14048)
vulnerabilities.name: libpng1.6/libpng16-16

vulnerabilities.title: Memory Leak
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libpng1.6` package. ** DISPUTED ** png_create_info_struct in png.c in libpng 1.6.36 has a memory leak, as demonstrated by pngcp. NOTE: a third party has stated "I don't think it is libpng's job to free this buffer." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libpng1.6`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-6129) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/glennrp/libpng/issues/269) - [Oracle Security Advisory](https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpujul2019-5072835.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libpng1.6/libpng16-16

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libpng1.6` package. An issue has been found in third-party PNM decoding associated with libpng 1.6.35. It is a stack-based buffer overflow in the function get_token in pnm2png.c in pnm2png. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libpng1.6`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-14550) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-14550) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201908-02) - [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/fouzhe/security/tree/master/libpng#stack-buffer-overflow-in-png2pnm-in-function-get_token) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/glennrp/libpng/issues/246) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuApr2021.html) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libpng1.6/libpng16-16

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libpng1.6` package. libpng before 1.6.32 does not properly check the length of chunks against the user limit. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libpng1.6`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://github.com/glennrp/libpng/blob/df7e9dae0c4aac63d55361e35709c864fa1b8363/ANNOUNCE) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K88124225) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K88124225?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-12652) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/109269) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-12652)
vulnerabilities.name: libpng1.6/libpng16-16

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libsepol` package. The CIL compiler in SELinux 3.2 has a use-after-free in __cil_verify_classperms (called from __cil_verify_classpermission and __cil_pre_verify_helper). ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libsepol`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-36084) - [MISC](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=31065) - [MISC](https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz-vulns/blob/main/vulns/selinux/OSV-2021-417.yaml) - [MISC](https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/f34d3d30c8325e4847a6b696fe7a3936a8a361f3)
vulnerabilities.name: libsepol/libsepol1

The CIL compiler in SELinux 3.2 has a use-after-free in __cil_verify_classperms (called from __verify_map_perm_classperms and hashtab_map). ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libsepol`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-36085) - [MISC](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=31124) - [MISC](https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz-vulns/blob/main/vulns/selinux/OSV-2021-421.yaml) - [MISC](https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/2d35fcc7e9e976a2346b1de20e54f8663e8a6cba)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libsepol` package. The CIL compiler in SELinux 3.2 has a use-after-free in cil_reset_classpermission (called from cil_reset_classperms_set and cil_reset_classperms_list). ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libsepol`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-36086) - [MISC](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=32177) - [MISC](https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz-vulns/blob/main/vulns/selinux/OSV-2021-536.yaml) - [MISC](https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/c49a8ea09501ad66e799ea41b8154b6770fec2c8)
vulnerabilities.name: libsepol/libsepol1

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libsepol` package. The CIL compiler in SELinux 3.2 has a heap-based buffer over-read in ebitmap_match_any (called indirectly from cil_check_neverallow). This occurs because there is sometimes a lack of checks for invalid statements in an optional block. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libsepol`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-36087) - [MISC](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=32675) - [MISC](https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz-vulns/blob/main/vulns/selinux/OSV-2021-585.yaml) - [MISC](https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/bad0a746e9f4cf260dedba5828d9645d50176aac)
vulnerabilities.name: libsepol/libsepol1

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libwebp` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. A flaw was found in libwebp in versions before 1.0.1. An out-of-bounds read was found in function ShiftBytes. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and to the service availability. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `libwebp` to version 0.5.2-1+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-25013) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4930) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1956926) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00005.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00006.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libwebp/libwebp6

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libwebp` package. A flaw was found in libwebp in versions before 1.0.1. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to the service availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `libwebp`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-36332) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4930) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1956868)
