vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in Systemd 245. A specially crafted DHCP FORCERENEW packet can cause a server running the DHCP client to be vulnerable to a DHCP ACK spoofing attack. An attacker can forge a pair of FORCERENEW and DCHP ACK packets to reconfigure the server. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13529) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210625-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1142) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. basic/unit-name.c in systemd prior to 246.15, 247.8, 248.5, and 249.1 has a Memory Allocation with an Excessive Size Value (involving strdupa and alloca for a pathname controlled by a local attacker) that results in an operating system crash. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `systemd` to version 232-25+deb9u13 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33910) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4942) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2LSDMHAKI4LGFOCSPXNVVSEWQFAVFWR7/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/163621/Sequoia-A-Deep-Root-In-Linuxs-Filesystem-Layer.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/b34a4f0e6729de292cb3b0c03c1d48f246ad896b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/20256/commits/441e0115646d54f080e5c3bb0ba477c892861ab9) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/releases) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/4a1c5f34bd3e1daed4490e9d97918e504d19733b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/764b74113e36ac5219a4b82a05f311b5a92136ce) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/b00674347337b7531c92fdb65590ab253bb57538) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/cfd14c65374027b34dbbc4f0551456c5dc2d1f61) - [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/07/20/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd-tmpfiles in systemd through 237 mishandles symlinks present in non-terminal path components, which allows local users to obtain ownership of arbitrary files via vectors involving creation of a directory and a file under that directory, and later replacing that directory with a symlink. This occurs even if the fs.protected_symlinks sysctl is turned on. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6954) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/7986) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00062.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-6954) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-2/)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered systemd does not correctly check the content of PIDFile files before using it to kill processes. When a service is run from an unprivileged user (e.g. User field set in the service file), a local attacker who is able to write to the PIDFile of the mentioned service may use this flaw to trick systemd into killing other services and/or privileged processes. Versions before v237 are vulnerable. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/5960a34a524848cd722fd7ab7e2227eac10107b0f90d9d1e9c3caa74@%3Cuser.cassandra.apache.org%3E) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16888) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190307-0007/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16888) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2091) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16888)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd v233 and earlier fails to safely parse usernames starting with a numeric digit (e.g. "0day"), running the service in question with root privileges rather than the user intended. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-1000082) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/6237) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/02/1) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99507) - [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Link Following
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd, when updating file permissions, allows local users to change the permissions and SELinux security contexts for arbitrary files via a symlink attack on unspecified files. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Bug Report](http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=725357) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-4392) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/10/01/9) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=859060)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Link Following
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd-tmpfiles in systemd before 237 attempts to support ownership/permission changes on hardlinked files even if the fs.protected_hardlinks sysctl is turned off, which allows local users to bypass intended access restrictions via vectors involving a hard link to a file for which the user lacks write access, as demonstrated by changing the ownership of the /etc/passwd file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/04/msg00022.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18078) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43935/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/7736) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/146184/systemd-Local-Privilege-Escalation.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Update](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2018-02/msg00109.html) - [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/01/29/4) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/01/29/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Privilege Assignment
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can create a SUID/SGID binary that would be allowed to run as the transient service UID/GID even after the service is terminated. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the UID/GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3843) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5JXQAKSTMABZ46EVCRMW62DHWYHTTFES/) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3843) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108116) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3843)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Privilege Chaining
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can get new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which would allow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with the setgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3844) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3844) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108096) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3844)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An issue was discovered in button_open in login/logind-button.c in systemd before 243. When executing the udevadm trigger command, a memory leak may occur. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20386) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/HZPCOMW5X6IZZXASCDD2CNW2DLF3YADC/) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/b2774a3ae692113e1f47a336a6c09bac9cfb49ad) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200210-0002/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-02/msg00014.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20386) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd before version v245-rc1, where asynchronous Polkit queries are performed while handling dbus messages. A local unprivileged attacker can abuse this flaw to crash systemd services or potentially execute code and elevate their privileges, by sending specially crafted dbus messages. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1712) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/1068447e6954dc6ce52f099ed174c442cb89ed54) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/637486261528e8aa3da9f26a4487dc254f4b7abb) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/bc130b6858327b382b07b3985cf48e2aa9016b2d) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/ea0d0ede03c6f18dbc5036c5e9cccf97e415ccc2) - [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/02/05/1) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1712) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1712)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd through v245 mishandles numerical usernames such as ones composed of decimal digits or 0x followed by hex digits, as demonstrated by use of root privileges when privileges of the 0x0 user account were intended. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13776) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0003/) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13776) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IYGLFEKG45EYBJ7TPQMLWROWPTZBEU63/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/15985)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in Systemd 245. A specially crafted DHCP FORCERENEW packet can cause a server running the DHCP client to be vulnerable to a DHCP ACK spoofing attack. An attacker can forge a pair of FORCERENEW and DCHP ACK packets to reconfigure the server. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13529) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210625-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1142) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. basic/unit-name.c in systemd prior to 246.15, 247.8, 248.5, and 249.1 has a Memory Allocation with an Excessive Size Value (involving strdupa and alloca for a pathname controlled by a local attacker) that results in an operating system crash. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `systemd` to version 232-25+deb9u13 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33910) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4942) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2LSDMHAKI4LGFOCSPXNVVSEWQFAVFWR7/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/163621/Sequoia-A-Deep-Root-In-Linuxs-Filesystem-Layer.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/b34a4f0e6729de292cb3b0c03c1d48f246ad896b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/20256/commits/441e0115646d54f080e5c3bb0ba477c892861ab9) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/releases) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/4a1c5f34bd3e1daed4490e9d97918e504d19733b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/764b74113e36ac5219a4b82a05f311b5a92136ce) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/b00674347337b7531c92fdb65590ab253bb57538) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/cfd14c65374027b34dbbc4f0551456c5dc2d1f61) - [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/07/20/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd-tmpfiles in systemd through 237 mishandles symlinks present in non-terminal path components, which allows local users to obtain ownership of arbitrary files via vectors involving creation of a directory and a file under that directory, and later replacing that directory with a symlink. This occurs even if the fs.protected_symlinks sysctl is turned on. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6954) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/7986) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00062.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-6954) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-2/)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered systemd does not correctly check the content of PIDFile files before using it to kill processes. When a service is run from an unprivileged user (e.g. User field set in the service file), a local attacker who is able to write to the PIDFile of the mentioned service may use this flaw to trick systemd into killing other services and/or privileged processes. Versions before v237 are vulnerable. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/5960a34a524848cd722fd7ab7e2227eac10107b0f90d9d1e9c3caa74@%3Cuser.cassandra.apache.org%3E) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16888) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190307-0007/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16888) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2091) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16888)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd v233 and earlier fails to safely parse usernames starting with a numeric digit (e.g. "0day"), running the service in question with root privileges rather than the user intended. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-1000082) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/6237) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/02/1) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99507) - [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13776) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0003/) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13776) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IYGLFEKG45EYBJ7TPQMLWROWPTZBEU63/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/15985)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in Systemd 245. A specially crafted DHCP FORCERENEW packet can cause a server running the DHCP client to be vulnerable to a DHCP ACK spoofing attack. An attacker can forge a pair of FORCERENEW and DCHP ACK packets to reconfigure the server. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13529) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210625-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1142) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. basic/unit-name.c in systemd prior to 246.15, 247.8, 248.5, and 249.1 has a Memory Allocation with an Excessive Size Value (involving strdupa and alloca for a pathname controlled by a local attacker) that results in an operating system crash. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `systemd` to version 232-25+deb9u13 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33910) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4942) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2LSDMHAKI4LGFOCSPXNVVSEWQFAVFWR7/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/163621/Sequoia-A-Deep-Root-In-Linuxs-Filesystem-Layer.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/b34a4f0e6729de292cb3b0c03c1d48f246ad896b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/20256/commits/441e0115646d54f080e5c3bb0ba477c892861ab9) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/releases) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/4a1c5f34bd3e1daed4490e9d97918e504d19733b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/764b74113e36ac5219a4b82a05f311b5a92136ce) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/b00674347337b7531c92fdb65590ab253bb57538) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/cfd14c65374027b34dbbc4f0551456c5dc2d1f61) - [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/07/20/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd-tmpfiles in systemd through 237 mishandles symlinks present in non-terminal path components, which allows local users to obtain ownership of arbitrary files via vectors involving creation of a directory and a file under that directory, and later replacing that directory with a symlink. This occurs even if the fs.protected_symlinks sysctl is turned on. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6954) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/7986) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00062.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-6954) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-2/)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered systemd does not correctly check the content of PIDFile files before using it to kill processes. When a service is run from an unprivileged user (e.g. User field set in the service file), a local attacker who is able to write to the PIDFile of the mentioned service may use this flaw to trick systemd into killing other services and/or privileged processes. Versions before v237 are vulnerable. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/5960a34a524848cd722fd7ab7e2227eac10107b0f90d9d1e9c3caa74@%3Cuser.cassandra.apache.org%3E) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16888) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190307-0007/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16888) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2091) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16888)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd v233 and earlier fails to safely parse usernames starting with a numeric digit (e.g. "0day"), running the service in question with root privileges rather than the user intended. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-1000082) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/6237) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/02/1) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99507) - [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Link Following
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd, when updating file permissions, allows local users to change the permissions and SELinux security contexts for arbitrary files via a symlink attack on unspecified files. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Bug Report](http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=725357) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-4392) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/10/01/9) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=859060)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Link Following
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd-tmpfiles in systemd before 237 attempts to support ownership/permission changes on hardlinked files even if the fs.protected_hardlinks sysctl is turned off, which allows local users to bypass intended access restrictions via vectors involving a hard link to a file for which the user lacks write access, as demonstrated by changing the ownership of the /etc/passwd file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/04/msg00022.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18078) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43935/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/7736) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/146184/systemd-Local-Privilege-Escalation.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Update](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2018-02/msg00109.html) - [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/01/29/4) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/01/29/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Privilege Assignment
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can create a SUID/SGID binary that would be allowed to run as the transient service UID/GID even after the service is terminated. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the UID/GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3843) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5JXQAKSTMABZ46EVCRMW62DHWYHTTFES/) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3843) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108116) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3843)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Privilege Chaining
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can get new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which would allow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with the setgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3844) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3844) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108096) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3844)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An issue was discovered in button_open in login/logind-button.c in systemd before 243. When executing the udevadm trigger command, a memory leak may occur. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20386) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/HZPCOMW5X6IZZXASCDD2CNW2DLF3YADC/) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/b2774a3ae692113e1f47a336a6c09bac9cfb49ad) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200210-0002/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-02/msg00014.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20386) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd before version v245-rc1, where asynchronous Polkit queries are performed while handling dbus messages. A local unprivileged attacker can abuse this flaw to crash systemd services or potentially execute code and elevate their privileges, by sending specially crafted dbus messages. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1712) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/1068447e6954dc6ce52f099ed174c442cb89ed54) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/637486261528e8aa3da9f26a4487dc254f4b7abb) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/bc130b6858327b382b07b3985cf48e2aa9016b2d) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/ea0d0ede03c6f18dbc5036c5e9cccf97e415ccc2) - [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/02/05/1) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1712) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1712)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd, when updating file permissions, allows local users to change the permissions and SELinux security contexts for arbitrary files via a symlink attack on unspecified files. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Bug Report](http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=725357) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-4392) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/10/01/9) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=859060)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Link Following
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd-tmpfiles in systemd before 237 attempts to support ownership/permission changes on hardlinked files even if the fs.protected_hardlinks sysctl is turned off, which allows local users to bypass intended access restrictions via vectors involving a hard link to a file for which the user lacks write access, as demonstrated by changing the ownership of the /etc/passwd file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/04/msg00022.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18078) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43935/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/7736) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/146184/systemd-Local-Privilege-Escalation.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Update](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2018-02/msg00109.html) - [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/01/29/4) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/01/29/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Privilege Assignment
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can create a SUID/SGID binary that would be allowed to run as the transient service UID/GID even after the service is terminated. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the UID/GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3843) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5JXQAKSTMABZ46EVCRMW62DHWYHTTFES/) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3843) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108116) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3843)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Privilege Chaining
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can get new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which would allow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with the setgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3844) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3844) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108096) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3844)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An issue was discovered in button_open in login/logind-button.c in systemd before 243. When executing the udevadm trigger command, a memory leak may occur. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20386) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/HZPCOMW5X6IZZXASCDD2CNW2DLF3YADC/) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/b2774a3ae692113e1f47a336a6c09bac9cfb49ad) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200210-0002/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-02/msg00014.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20386) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd before version v245-rc1, where asynchronous Polkit queries are performed while handling dbus messages. A local unprivileged attacker can abuse this flaw to crash systemd services or potentially execute code and elevate their privileges, by sending specially crafted dbus messages. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1712) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/1068447e6954dc6ce52f099ed174c442cb89ed54) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/637486261528e8aa3da9f26a4487dc254f4b7abb) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/bc130b6858327b382b07b3985cf48e2aa9016b2d) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/ea0d0ede03c6f18dbc5036c5e9cccf97e415ccc2) - [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/02/05/1) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1712) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1712)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd through v245 mishandles numerical usernames such as ones composed of decimal digits or 0x followed by hex digits, as demonstrated by use of root privileges when privileges of the 0x0 user account were intended. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13776) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0003/) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13776) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IYGLFEKG45EYBJ7TPQMLWROWPTZBEU63/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/15985)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in Systemd 245. A specially crafted DHCP FORCERENEW packet can cause a server running the DHCP client to be vulnerable to a DHCP ACK spoofing attack. An attacker can forge a pair of FORCERENEW and DCHP ACK packets to reconfigure the server. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13529) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210625-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1142) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. basic/unit-name.c in systemd prior to 246.15, 247.8, 248.5, and 249.1 has a Memory Allocation with an Excessive Size Value (involving strdupa and alloca for a pathname controlled by a local attacker) that results in an operating system crash. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `systemd` to version 232-25+deb9u13 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33910) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4942) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2LSDMHAKI4LGFOCSPXNVVSEWQFAVFWR7/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/163621/Sequoia-A-Deep-Root-In-Linuxs-Filesystem-Layer.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/b34a4f0e6729de292cb3b0c03c1d48f246ad896b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/20256/commits/441e0115646d54f080e5c3bb0ba477c892861ab9) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/releases) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/4a1c5f34bd3e1daed4490e9d97918e504d19733b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/764b74113e36ac5219a4b82a05f311b5a92136ce) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/b00674347337b7531c92fdb65590ab253bb57538) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/cfd14c65374027b34dbbc4f0551456c5dc2d1f61) - [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/07/20/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd-tmpfiles in systemd through 237 mishandles symlinks present in non-terminal path components, which allows local users to obtain ownership of arbitrary files via vectors involving creation of a directory and a file under that directory, and later replacing that directory with a symlink. This occurs even if the fs.protected_symlinks sysctl is turned on. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6954) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/7986) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00062.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-6954) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-2/)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered systemd does not correctly check the content of PIDFile files before using it to kill processes. When a service is run from an unprivileged user (e.g. User field set in the service file), a local attacker who is able to write to the PIDFile of the mentioned service may use this flaw to trick systemd into killing other services and/or privileged processes. Versions before v237 are vulnerable. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/5960a34a524848cd722fd7ab7e2227eac10107b0f90d9d1e9c3caa74@%3Cuser.cassandra.apache.org%3E) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16888) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190307-0007/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16888) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2091) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16888)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd v233 and earlier fails to safely parse usernames starting with a numeric digit (e.g. "0day"), running the service in question with root privileges rather than the user intended. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-1000082) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/6237) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/02/1) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99507) - [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13776) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0003/) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13776) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IYGLFEKG45EYBJ7TPQMLWROWPTZBEU63/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/15985)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in Systemd 245. A specially crafted DHCP FORCERENEW packet can cause a server running the DHCP client to be vulnerable to a DHCP ACK spoofing attack. An attacker can forge a pair of FORCERENEW and DCHP ACK packets to reconfigure the server. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13529) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210625-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1142) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. basic/unit-name.c in systemd prior to 246.15, 247.8, 248.5, and 249.1 has a Memory Allocation with an Excessive Size Value (involving strdupa and alloca for a pathname controlled by a local attacker) that results in an operating system crash. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `systemd` to version 232-25+deb9u13 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33910) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4942) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2LSDMHAKI4LGFOCSPXNVVSEWQFAVFWR7/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/42TMJVNYRY65B4QCJICBYOEIVZV3KUYI/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-48) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/163621/Sequoia-A-Deep-Root-In-Linuxs-Filesystem-Layer.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/b34a4f0e6729de292cb3b0c03c1d48f246ad896b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/20256/commits/441e0115646d54f080e5c3bb0ba477c892861ab9) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/releases) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/4a1c5f34bd3e1daed4490e9d97918e504d19733b) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/764b74113e36ac5219a4b82a05f311b5a92136ce) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/b00674347337b7531c92fdb65590ab253bb57538) - [MISC](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/commit/cfd14c65374027b34dbbc4f0551456c5dc2d1f61) - [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/07/20/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/04/2) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/17/3) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/07/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd-tmpfiles in systemd through 237 mishandles symlinks present in non-terminal path components, which allows local users to obtain ownership of arbitrary files via vectors involving creation of a directory and a file under that directory, and later replacing that directory with a symlink. This occurs even if the fs.protected_symlinks sysctl is turned on. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6954) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/7986) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00062.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-6954) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3816-2/)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered systemd does not correctly check the content of PIDFile files before using it to kill processes. When a service is run from an unprivileged user (e.g. User field set in the service file), a local attacker who is able to write to the PIDFile of the mentioned service may use this flaw to trick systemd into killing other services and/or privileged processes. Versions before v237 are vulnerable. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/5960a34a524848cd722fd7ab7e2227eac10107b0f90d9d1e9c3caa74@%3Cuser.cassandra.apache.org%3E) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16888) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190307-0007/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16888) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2091) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16888)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd v233 and earlier fails to safely parse usernames starting with a numeric digit (e.g. "0day"), running the service in question with root privileges rather than the user intended. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-1000082) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/6237) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/02/1) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99507) - [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Link Following
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd, when updating file permissions, allows local users to change the permissions and SELinux security contexts for arbitrary files via a symlink attack on unspecified files. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Bug Report](http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=725357) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-4392) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/10/01/9) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=859060)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Link Following
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd-tmpfiles in systemd before 237 attempts to support ownership/permission changes on hardlinked files even if the fs.protected_hardlinks sysctl is turned off, which allows local users to bypass intended access restrictions via vectors involving a hard link to a file for which the user lacks write access, as demonstrated by changing the ownership of the /etc/passwd file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/04/msg00022.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18078) - [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43935/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/7736) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/146184/systemd-Local-Privilege-Escalation.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Update](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2018-02/msg00109.html) - [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/01/29/4) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/01/29/3)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Privilege Assignment
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can create a SUID/SGID binary that would be allowed to run as the transient service UID/GID even after the service is terminated. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the UID/GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3843) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5JXQAKSTMABZ46EVCRMW62DHWYHTTFES/) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3843) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108116) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3843)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Privilege Chaining
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can get new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which would allow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with the setgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3844) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3844) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108096) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3844)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An issue was discovered in button_open in login/logind-button.c in systemd before 243. When executing the udevadm trigger command, a memory leak may occur. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20386) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/HZPCOMW5X6IZZXASCDD2CNW2DLF3YADC/) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/b2774a3ae692113e1f47a336a6c09bac9cfb49ad) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200210-0002/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-02/msg00014.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20386) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd before version v245-rc1, where asynchronous Polkit queries are performed while handling dbus messages. A local unprivileged attacker can abuse this flaw to crash systemd services or potentially execute code and elevate their privileges, by sending specially crafted dbus messages. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1712) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/1068447e6954dc6ce52f099ed174c442cb89ed54) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/637486261528e8aa3da9f26a4487dc254f4b7abb) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/bc130b6858327b382b07b3985cf48e2aa9016b2d) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/ea0d0ede03c6f18dbc5036c5e9cccf97e415ccc2) - [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/02/05/1) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1712) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1712)

NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13776) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0003/) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13776) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IYGLFEKG45EYBJ7TPQMLWROWPTZBEU63/) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/15985)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tar` package. A flaw was found in the src/list.c of tar 1.33 and earlier. This flaw allows an attacker who can submit a crafted input file to tar to cause uncontrolled consumption of memory. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `tar`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20193) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202105-29) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1917565) - [MISC](https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/tar.git/commit/?id=d9d4435692150fa8ff68e1b1a473d187cc3fd777) - [MISC](https://savannah.gnu.org/bugs/?59897)
vulnerabilities.name: tar

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tar` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. GNU Tar through 1.30, when --sparse is used, mishandles file shrinkage during read access, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (infinite read loop in sparse_dump_region in sparse.c) by modifying a file that is supposed to be archived by a different user's process (e.g., a system backup running as root). ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `tar` to version 1.29b-1.1+deb9u1 or higher. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20482) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/12/msg00023.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20482) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201903-05) - [MISC](http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/tar.git/commit/?id=c15c42ccd1e2377945fd0414eca1a49294bff454) - [MISC](http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-tar/2018-12/msg00023.html) - [MISC](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=18745431) - [MISC](https://twitter.com/thatcks/status/1076166645708668928) - [MISC](https://utcc.utoronto.ca/~cks/space/blog/sysadmin/TarFindingTruncateBug) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00077.html) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106354) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20482)
vulnerabilities.name: tar

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2005-2541
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tar` package. Tar 1.15.1 does not properly warn the user when extracting setuid or setgid files, which may allow local users or remote attackers to gain privileges. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `tar`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2005-2541) - [HP Security Bulletin](http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=112327628230258&w=2) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rc713534b10f9daeee2e0990239fa407e2118e4aa9e88a7041177497c@%3Cissues.guacamole.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: tar

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tar` package. pax_decode_header in sparse.c in GNU Tar before 1.32 had a NULL pointer dereference when parsing certain archives that have malformed extended headers. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `tar`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9923) - [MISC](http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/tar.git/commit/?id=cb07844454d8cc9fb21f53ace75975f91185a120) - [MISC](http://savannah.gnu.org/bugs/?55369) - [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/tar/+bug/1810241) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00077.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9923)
vulnerabilities.name: tar

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tiff` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. An integer overflow flaw was found in libtiff that exists in the tif_getimage.c file. This flaw allows an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary code when a user opens a crafted TIFF file. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `tiff` to version 4.0.8-2+deb9u6 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35523) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210521-0009/) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4869) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BMHBYFMX3D5VGR6Y3RXTTH3Q4NF4E6IG/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202104-06) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1932040) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/commit/c8d613ef497058fe653c467fc84c70a62a4a71b2) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/merge_requests/160) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00023.html)
vulnerabilities.name: tiff/libtiff5

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tiff` package. See `How to fix?` for `Debian:9` relevant versions. A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in libtiff in the handling of TIFF images in libtiff's TIFF2PDF tool. A specially crafted TIFF file can lead to arbitrary code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability. ## Remediation Upgrade `Debian:9` `tiff` to version 4.0.8-2+deb9u6 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35524) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210521-0009/) - [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4869) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BMHBYFMX3D5VGR6Y3RXTTH3Q4NF4E6IG/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202104-06) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1932044) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/merge_requests/159) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/rzkn/libtiff/-/commit/7be2e452ddcf6d7abca88f41d3761e6edab72b22) - [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00023.html)
vulnerabilities.name: tiff/libtiff5

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tiff` package. In LibTIFF, there is a memory malloc failure in tif_pixarlog.c. A crafted TIFF document can lead to an abort, resulting in a remote denial of service attack. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:9` `tiff`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35522) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210521-0009/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BMHBYFMX3D5VGR6Y3RXTTH3Q4NF4E6IG/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202104-06) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1932037)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tiff` package. A flaw was found in libtiff.
